column4: if i use wine which gives functionality and looks of window on linux...then what is the difference using linux over window...can u plz tell me
i think you've got wine misunderstood.  it doesn't give the 'looks' of windows.  it is a tool that runs windows applications in linux.

developers basically integrated all the windows dll files (re-engineered) for the linux kernel backend, among other things.  this way, windows apps *think* they're running in windows when in actuality they were always running in linux
on a side point, the wine devs have worked long and hard to dispel the notion that wine is an 'emulator'.  it's not.  and, they deserve a whole heck of a lot of credit for what they've accomplished
